revised_title: Investigating the Passage of Röntgen Rays through Gases and Vapours
tldr: The authors investigate the absorption, ionization, and secondary radiation produced by Röntgen rays passing through various gases and vapors. They develop an apparatus to measure these phenomena and find that the ionization produced in the gas is proportional to the pressure of the gas, while the energy of the penetrating secondary radiation is also simply proportional to the pressure.
